intro: Sutera maxii, commonly known as the Mexican evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Sutera maxii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
